post.description:
Create a withdrawal to send funds from a Paystand account to an external bank account. Provide an amount, currency, and bankId to create a withdrawal. Optionally provide a short description and meta to help describe and link the withdrawal to an external system. Specify an "accountKey" to use a specific paystand account as a source of funds for the withdrawal. The "default" paystand account for the customer will be used if no "accountKey" is specified in the request.

The withdrawal amount may not exceed the current available balance. The current available balance is determined by summing all payments with status "paid" and subtracting any refunds, disputes, holds, fees, and/or withdrawals. Withdrawals will usually appear in the bank account within two business days of the withdrawal being submitted.

bankId.description: The id of the bank to send funds to.

accountKey.description: The key of the account to be used as a source of funds

meta.description: Optional key/values to help link the withdrawal to an external system.

description.description: An optional description of the withdrawal.

parameters.name: withdrawalId
parameters.description: The id of the withdrawal.

put.description: Update a withdrawal's description or meta details. Note that once a withdrawal is created the amount, currency, accountKey, and bankId cannot be updated.

parameters.name: withdrawalId
parameters.description: The id of the withdrawal.

meta.description: Optional key/values to help link the withdrawal to an external system.

put.description:
Withdrawals can be scheduled to automatically be sent daily or weekly.  You can configure auto-withdrawals for a customer by managing their withdrawal settings. When the schedule runs, all available funds will attempt to be withdrawn. One withdrawal will be created for each account. Each account can be configured to have their funds sent to a different bank account.

The order of accounts listed in "active" is very important. When the auto-withdrawal schedule runs, withdrawals will attempt to draw from the accounts in the order given. However, if any accounts carry a negative balance, it will impact the maximum amount that can be withdrawn from any accounts with a positive balance. As a result, if there are active accounts with a negative balance, active accounts with a positive balance may not be able to withdraw all of their funds. The "active" list acts as a priority list of which accounts should take precedence over others.

One of `payerId` or `payer` values are required in the request, but not both.
Only one of `bank`, `cardId`, `bankId`, or `tokenId` are required in the request.
The `accountKey` field defaults to the customer's default account.

get.description: Once a payment has been posted and assured, its assurety record can be retrieved. The assurety record will not be available while the payment is in the process of being assured or before a payment is posted.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The id of the payment

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: The type of assurety, possible values are: posted

get.description: Returns a list of all refunds youve previously created. The refunds are returned in sorted order, with the most recent refunds appearing first. For convenience, pagination is available with the limit and offset parameters.

parameters.name: startDate
parameters.description: Filters the list based on the object "created" field, will return records whose created date is greater than or equal to the startDate.

parameters.name: endDate
parameters.description: Filters the list based on the object "created" field, will return records whose created date is less than or equal to the endDate.

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: Defines how data should be return, accepted values: ["json", "csv"]

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: Use for pagination, how many records should the query skip

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Defines how many values should it return, accepted value range between 1 and 200

get.description: Returns a list of all withdrawals youve previously created. The withdrawals are returned in sorted order, with the most recent refunds appearing first. For convenience, pagination is available with the limit and offset parameters.

parameters.name: startDate
parameters.description: Date string that detonates records greater than or equal to the created date

parameters.name: endDate
parameters.description: Date string that detonates records less than or equal to the created date

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: Defines how data should be return, accepted values: ["json", "csv"]

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: Use for pagination, how many records should the query skip

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Defines how many values should it return, accepted value range between 1 and 200

post.description:
One of `payerId` or `payer` values are required in the request, but not both.
Only one of `bank`, `cardId`, `bankId`, or `tokenId` are required in the request.

cardId.description: The id of the card that was previously created.

bank.description: The bank object to use for a bank payment

bankId.description: The id of the bank that was previously created.

tokenId.description: The id of a token previously registered.

payer.description: A payer object to create and assign to the card. Required when making a request with bank/card object

payerId.description: The id of the payer to assign to the card. Required when making a request with bank/card object

schedule.description: The schedule object to define when the payments would run and number of times.

name.description: A name for the scheduled payment.

description.description: A short description of the scheduled payment.
description.default: Monthly scheduled payment under coupon MarchMadness

meta.description: Optional key/values to help link the scheduled payment to an external system.

customFields.description: A list of merchant defined fields.
